class.name: File
class.brief_description: Type to handle file reading and writing operations.

method.name: close
method.description: Closes the currently opened file.

method.name: eof_reached
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the file cursor has reached the end of the file.

method.name: file_exists
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the file exists in the given path.

method.name: get_16
method.description: Returns the next 16 bits from the file as an integer.

method.name: get_32
method.description: Returns the next 32 bits from the file as an integer.

method.name: get_64
method.description: Returns the next 64 bits from the file as an integer.

method.name: get_8
method.description: Returns the next 8 bits from the file as an integer.

method.name: get_as_text
method.description: Returns the whole file as a [String].

method.name: get_buffer
method.description: Returns next [code]len[/code] bytes of the file as a [PoolByteArray].

method.name: get_csv_line
method.description: Returns the next value of the file in CSV (Comma Separated Values) format. You can pass a different delimiter to use other than the default "," (comma).

method.name: get_double
method.description: Returns the next 64 bits from the file as a floating point number.

method.name: get_endian_swap
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if endian swap is enabled for this file.

method.name: get_error
method.description: Returns the last error that happened when trying to perform operations. Compare with the [code]ERR_FILE_*[/code] constants from [@GlobalScope].

method.name: get_float
method.description: Returns the next 32 bits from the file as a floating point number.

method.name: get_len
method.description: Returns the size of the file in bytes.

method.name: get_line
method.description: Returns the next line of the file as a [String].

method.name: get_md5
method.description: Returns an MD5 String representing the file at the given path or an empty [String] on failure.

method.name: get_modified_time
method.description: Returns the last time the [code]file[/code] was modified in unix timestamp format or returns a [String] "ERROR IN [code]file[/code]". This unix timestamp can be converted to datetime by using [method OS.get_datetime_from_unix_time].

method.name: get_pascal_string
method.description: Returns a [String] saved in Pascal format from the file.

method.name: get_position
method.description: Returns the file cursor's position.

method.name: get_real
method.description: Returns the next bits from the file as a floating point number.

method.name: get_sha256
method.description: Returns a SHA-256 [String] representing the file at the given path or an empty [String] on failure.

method.name: get_var
method.description: Returns the next [Variant] value from the file.

method.name: is_open
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the file is currently opened.

method.name: open
method.description: Opens the file for writing or reading, depending on the flags.

method.name: open_compressed
method.description: Opens a compressed file for reading or writing. Use COMPRESSION_* constants to set [code]compression_mode[/code].

method.name: open_encrypted
method.description: Opens an encrypted file in write or read mode. You need to pass a binary key to encrypt/decrypt it.

method.name: open_encrypted_with_pass
method.description: Opens an encrypted file in write or read mode. You need to pass a password to encrypt/decrypt it.

method.name: seek
method.description: Change the file reading/writing cursor to the specified position (in bytes from the beginning of the file).

method.name: seek_end
method.description: Changes the file reading/writing cursor to the specified position (in bytes from the end of the file). Note that this is an offset, so you should use negative numbers or the cursor will be at the end of the file.

method.name: set_endian_swap
method.description: If [code]true[/code] the file's endianness is swapped. Use this if you're dealing with files written in big endian machines. Note that this is about the file format, not CPU type. This is always reseted to [code]false[/code] whenever you open the file.

method.name: store_16
method.description: Stores an integer as 16 bits in the file.

method.name: store_32
method.description: Stores an integer as 32 bits in the file.

method.name: store_64
method.description: Stores an integer as 64 bits in the file.

method.name: store_8
method.description: Stores an integer as 8 bits in the file.

method.name: store_buffer
method.description: Stores the given array of bytes in the file.

method.name: store_double
method.description: Stores a floating point number as 64 bits in the file.

method.name: store_float
method.description: Stores a floating point number as 32 bits in the file.

method.name: store_line
method.description: Stores the given [String] as a line in the file.

method.name: store_pascal_string
method.description: Stores the given [String] as a line in the file in Pascal format (i.e. also store the length of the string).

method.name: store_real
method.description: Stores a floating point number in the file.

method.name: store_string
method.description: Stores the given [String] in the file.

method.name: store_var
method.description: Stores any Variant value in the file.

constants.constant: Opens the file for read operations.
Opens the file for write operations. Create it if the file does not exist and truncate if it exists.
Opens the file for read and write operations. Does not truncate the file.
Opens the file for read and write operations. Create it if the file does not exist and truncate if it exists.
